name: ONAP-DMaaP-messagerouter
description: DMaaP Message Router is a reliable, high-volume pub/sub messaging service with a RESTful HTTP API that is delivered as a web service using AJSC framework. The service is built over Apache Kafka
contribution_justification:
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Joining+the+Community
 https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA 
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developing+ONAP
contribution_requirements_justification:
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies

The Java code should meet the requirement of Google Java Style - https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html except indents are 4 spaces and column limit is 120 which is described here: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style Developer Best Practices: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developer+Best+Practices
license_location_justification:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/dmaapclient.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE.txt;h=bb235ffb2c8ad2f08521a713c7a648e81dc7f8b5;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE.txt;h=bb235ffb2c8ad2f08521a713c7a648e81dc7f8b5;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/msgrtr.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE.txt;h=bb235ffb2c8ad2f08521a713c7a648e81dc7f8b5;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/mirroragent.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE.txt;h=bb235ffb2c8ad2f08521a713c7a648e81dc7f8b5;hb=HEAD
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
report_tracker_justification: ira is used to track issues: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
warnings_strict_justification: Build systems run the compile with test flag enabled by default. So any failure in test cases will fail the ci and the merge request.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: The code is written in Java, which is a memory-safe language
crypto_weaknesses_justification: All generated certificates are generated with sha256
hardening_justification: The project tries to use hardening mechanism whenever possible. Eg we use transaction id for tracking transactions through multiple services and also we use http headers to identify the application where possible
crypto_used_network_justification: The projects supports secure TLS and HTTPS and insecure protocols are disabled by default in these applications, they can be over-ridden by user configuration
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: Certificate validation is done before answering any calls.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: The certificate is validated before sending http headers or private information.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: All packages are delivered either as an jar artifact or a docker image. In case of maven artifacts, they can be removed using the pom file. In case of docker container. We can delete the container we dont want. Also control the orchestration in Kubernetes if you want to exclude certain docker images.
dco_justification:
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
ONAP requires both a Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO), and a Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Contribution+Agreements e.g. of signed-off commit: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/c/66789/
governance_justification:
The project governance is described at

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance

Further information can be found at https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Technical+Community+Document
roles_responsibilities_justification: The key roles in the project and their responsibilities are described at: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance Current members are listed at: https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8226539
access_continuity_justification: For DMaaP there are 5 committers and multiple contributors who are listed in: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Resources+and+Repositories#ResourcesandRepositories-DataMovementasaPlatform All 5 committers have access and rights to maintain the code base, approve and review incoming changes and release a new version of the artifact. This will let the project continue with minimal to no interruption if one person is incapacitated. Also this project is controlled by the linux foundation so we can add more committers if needed
bus_factor_justification:
All the projects covered in this report have more than 2 persons who actively contribute and maintain code. The following links provides with list of commit owners for the project which list at least two or more individuals:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/kafka11aaf+branch:master
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/messagerouter/dmaapclient+branch:master
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice+branch:master
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/messagerouter/mirroragent+branch:master
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/q/project:dmaap/messagerouter/msgrtr+branch:master
documentation_architecture_justification: Architecture of DMaaP Message Router can be found at https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice.git/docs/architecture/architecture.html
documentation_current_justification: Documentation is updated with each release
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: The DMaaP Message Router project does not have any user interface. It exposes an API and fulfills a contract https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/admin/projects/dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice
internationalization_justification: The DMaaP Message Router project does not have any user interface. It exposes an API and fulfills a contract https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/admin/projects/dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice
sites_password_security_justification: The project does not store passwords for authentication of external users
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when a upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerabilities can be reported using the link https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6591711 Currently we dont have any vulnerabilities reported, but the wiki page explains on how to report a vulnerability and how to report anonymously if you do not want the credit for it.
coding_standards_justification: Project uses Google Java Style with changes explained here - https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style
build_standard_variables_justification: The application does not create native binaries as it creates a jar.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries as it creates a jar.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The compiled docker images and jar files can be installed/used as the user sees fit. Both run on JVM or docker. So there is no reason to selecting locations etc.
installation_development_quick_justifica: amount of resources, we can deploy the full DMaaP/ONAP suite in less than a day. The steps are documented in https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/oom.git/docs/oom_quickstart_guide.html
external_dependencies_justification:
External dependencies are controlled using the pom file, which can be found in the root folder of each of the projects modules:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/kafka11aaf.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=3154bd5024956a5ea8488059c6e0ae229f850573;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/dmaapclient.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=f0268bf9e603d5dbe7b1b87ab5b71fcf179a1a36;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/messageservice.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=5948ef7dc8bc599965abbe09e9b02fb42eedbf32;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/msgrtr.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=f9d66a67193dc88cce2628f63209692bb3a3c0fb;hb=HEAD
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=dmaap/messagerouter/dmaapclient.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=f0268bf9e603d5dbe7b1b87ab5b71fcf179a1a36;hb=HEAD
dependency_monitoring_justification:
NexusIQ sonar scan is run on the project on a weekly basis
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-messagerouter-dmaapclient-maven-clm-master/
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-messagerouter-messageservice-maven-clm-master/
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-messagerouter-mirroragent-maven-clm-master/
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/CLM/job/dmaap-messagerouter-msgrtr-maven-clm-master/
updateable_reused_components_justificati: External components are maintained through Maven. The user can get a list of all included components using the maven dependency tree and can update or reuse as they see fit
automated_integration_testing_justificat:
*Verify and *merge jobs run the test cases whenever a file is added to the repo
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/dmaap/
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
input_validation_justification: The project strives to validate all input to functions. The inputs that are provided to the services are checked against existing models such as OXM or search-abstraction layer and only valid inputs are allowed to be pass through
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: Certificates are managed through AAF micro-service which will be deployed with ONAP suite
signed_releases_justification: All release artifacts are signed by the Linux Foundation prior to release.
version_tags_signed_justification: All releases (which are tagged major/minor/patch) are signed by Linux Foundation

name: usecase-ui
description: Usecase UI is the ONAP subsystem that provides Graphical User Interface (GUI) for operators and end-users from the point of view of use cases. As a whole project, Usecase UI requiremetns not only includes service design and run-time management (resource, performance, fault, security, configuration, etc.) for operators, but also includes self-service management for end-users.

enhancement_responses_justification: The enhancement request are being handled as soon as possible.

vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
The Vulnerability could be reported either as a feature or a issue. In case the vulnerability involves large changes, e.g. framework change, it could be reported as a feature. In case the vulnerability is due to bugs in the code, it could be reported as a bug.

The reporting process is in the following URL: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Private vulnerability reports are not supported
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: There's no vulnerabilities reported so far.
build_justification:
Jenkins is used to automatically build the Usecase-UI project. The project URL is :

https://jenkins.onap.org/view/usecase-ui
build_common_tools_justification: Maven is used to build Usecase-UI.
test_invocation_justification: The test runs automatically during the building process.
test_most_justification: Test suits covers most of the functionality .
test_policy_justification: When new functionality is added we will add the corresponding unit test, when we merge the code, the test will be run automatically
warnings_justification: Sonar is used to examine the quality of the source code. Sonar uses different rules to verify the quality of the code and to address the vulnerability of the code
warnings_strict_justification: Perfection is not the target but the project is being improved on each release to reach the best practical warning settings, where technically feasible.
crypto_published_justification: Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms
delivery_mitm_justification: The website to store the delivered software is: https://nexus3.onap.org/
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: Usecase-UI uses tool like Sonar to detect vulnerabilities and fix it as soon as possible when find any.
static_analysis_justification: Sonar is used for static code analysis.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: Sonar uses different rules for static code analysis.
dynamic_analysis_justification: Sonar is used as Dynamic code analysis tool
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Usecase-UI uses assertions in unit test
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: After discovering the vulnerabilities, they will be fixed as soon as possible.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: The test will be run automatically during the building process . Once build successfully and all tests has past, the Merge option will be activated.
discussion_justification:
A mailing list is used for project related discussion. New users could also check, search the old discussion online at onap-discuss website

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Joining+the+Community
english_justification: JIRA is used to track bugs. The URL is : https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
hardening_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
crypto_used_network_justification: Currently Usecase-UI will support secure protocols (HTTPS) in next release. [2019/11/08]
crypto_tls12_justification: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: The applications can be installed either using Docker via HEAT, or Kubernetes via Helm scripts.
code_of_conduct_justification:
ONAP adheres to the Linux Foundation Code of Conduct, found at
https://lfprojects.org/policies/code-of-conduct
documentation_current_justification: Documentation is version controlled and is part of the source repositories. Usecase-UI documentation is integrated in ONAP and is released/reviewed as part of each ONAP release.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: Overall ONAP adherence to this is probably going to be handled ONAP wide, Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
internationalization_justification: Usecase-UI has implemented internationalization by i18n in Dublin Release.
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when an upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed.
coding_standards_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
build_standard_variables_justification: The application does not create native binaries (java based application).
build_preserve_debug_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result. Note that this relies on the availability of imported artifacts and dependencies.
installation_standard_variables_justific: Docker containers are used for installation, so the conventions of the host operating system are not relevant.
external_dependencies_justification:
The dependencies are listed in the POM.xml files of each project under respective repos.
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=usecase-ui.git;a=blob;f=pom.xml;h=d55c7cdd416df28da017b836f8dead16f336de2b;hb=refs/heads/master

dependency_monitoring_justification: We use sonatype CLM https://nexus-iq.wl.linuxfoundation.org/ and https://sonar.onap.org
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Maven is used to manage external component versions, and the automated Jenkins build jobs will ensure the deployable artifacts are up to date with the maven changes. Updating an external component simply involves making an update to the pom.xml file for that project.
interfaces_current_justification: We choose free open source solutions in every case and choose up-to-date versions of the components (aligned with the overall framework releases we adopt).
regression_tests_added50_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.
implement_secure_design_justification: in case of exception or any other issue during login, the login is denied
input_validation_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.

crypto_credential_agility_justification: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
signed_releases_justification: Currently Usecase-UI didn't use any cryptographic protocols and algorithms. [2019/10/07]
assurance_case_justification: Usecase-UI will schedule it as a feature for future releases.

name: codepulse
description: Code Pulse is a real-time code coverage tool for penetration testing activities
description_good_justification: http://code-pulse.com/ in the "Why Code Pulse?" section.
interact_justification: Links are provided to GitHub pages which contain methods for submitting feedback, issues, and contributions.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/codedx/codepulse/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: The Code Pulse wiki page serves as documentation: https://github.com/codedx/codepulse/wiki
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Interim commits are made to the repository, including the usage of branches for development, features, bugs, and other such uses.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Release notes made for each release, including what the major changes are and what the known issues are: https://github.com/codedx/codepulse/releases
release_notes_vulns_justification: There are no CVEs currently for Code Pulse.
report_responses_justification: Most issue reports result in a dialog between the reporter and developer(s). https://github.com/codedx/codepulse/issues
report_archive_justification: Issues are public and maintained through GitHub's system: https://github.com/codedx/codepulse/issues
build_justification: The source repository contains ready-to-go build procedures that is largely automated and free of having to setup other dependencies. This is also exercised when commits are made to the repository, as an automated build system is used to ensure proper build and test.
build_common_tools_justification: The application's backend is primarily scala and built with SBT. The application's frontend is primarily web-based and built with nw.js.
build_floss_tools_justification: SBT uses the BSD-3 license and nw.js uses the MIT license.
test_justification: ScalaTest is used for scala tests and is Apache 2.0 license.
test_invocation_justification: Standard test invocation through SBT and through automated builds.
know_secure_design_justification: Multiple primary developers are versed in secure coding practices.
know_common_errors_justification: Variety of errors that lead to vulnerabilities are known and countered through choice of development and tools or first/third-party libraries used.
delivery_unsigned_justification: We currently do not use or send any cryptographic hash.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: There are currently no known vulnerabilities. Such vulnerabilities would be fixed in a timely fashion if discovered.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: There are currently no known vulnerabilities. Such vulnerabilities would be fixed in a timely fashion if discovered.
static_analysis_justification: Via Code Dx, Checkstyle, Cppcheck, JSHint, PHP_CodeSniffer, PMD, and Scalastyle are run. When bytecode is provided, dependency check is run.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: Via Code Dx, a variety of tools can and are run against the project, including tools used to discover vulnerabilities and can be enhanced further with new tools. For instance, dependency check is one such tool.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Currently there are no dynamic analyses run that would indicate exploitable vulnerabilities.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Code Pulse is built via AppVeyor which automates build and incorporates automated tests.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: The Code Pulse wiki (https://github.com/codedx/codepulse) provides English language documentation. GitHub discussion and issues may be English language.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

Usage of HTTPS with TLS 1.2 with SHA-2

https://jira.onap.org/browse/EXTAPI-255

crypto_used_network_justification:
Usage of HTTPS with TLS 1.2 with SHA-2

[2020/01/13]
 by default NBI exposes HTTPS with self signed certificates
https://jira.onap.org/browse/EXTAPI-255

For Frankfurt Release both HTTP and HTTPS port are enable ( in order to no break functional usecase implementation for this release, HTTP will be switched off for the next release )
https://jira.onap.org/browse/EXTAPI-379

NBI consumes all inernal HTTP API, msb, dmaap, so, sdc, aai with HTTPS TLS 1.2
crypto_certificate_verification_justific:
[2020/01/13]
AAF_RootCA.cer used as Root CA to check all server certificates ( msb, aai, sdc, so, dmaap ). Root certificate imported in java keystore while building docker image

https://git.onap.org/externalapi/nbi/tree/Dockerfile 

RUN for cert in $(ls -d /certs/*); do \
        echo "adding $cert to java keystore..."; \
        keytool -import \
                -file "$cert" \
                -storepass "${CERT_PASS}" \
                -keystore $JAVA_HOME/lib/security/cacerts \
                -alias "$(basename $cert)" \
                --noprompt; \
    done

name: ONAP Modeling
description: ONAP TOSCA parser and ETSI catalog tools, the generic parser is provided since Dublin release.
contribution_justification: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
license_location_justification: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=modeling/etsicatalog.git;a=blob;f=LICENSE
documentation_basics_justification:
https://onap-modeling-modelspec.readthedocs.io
https://onap-modeling-toscaparsers.readthedocs.io
repo_public_justification: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/modeling/
repo_track_justification: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/modeling/
version_unique_justification: Release version is with format ${major}.${minor}.${patch} and will be updated accordingly for each release.
report_tracker_justification: Jira is used to track issues. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
report_process_justification: The description of the process can be found in the following URL: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
build_floss_tools_justification: Maven is used and it is under Apache 2.0 license
tests_documented_added_justification: This is documented on our wiki on Code Coverage and Static Code Analysis: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Code+Coverage+and+Static+Code+Analysis and https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Creating+a+CSIT+Test
warnings_strict_justification: Build systems run the compile with test flag enabled by default. So any failure in test cases will fail the ci and the merge request.
static_analysis_justification: Sonar is used for static code analysis.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: Sonar uses different rules for static code analysis.
dynamic_analysis_justification: Sonar is used as Dynamic code analysis tool
discussion_justification: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Joining+the+Community
english_justification: JIRA is used to track bugs. The URL is : https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
hardening_justification: we don't have those mechanism yet in our HTTP headers
crypto_used_network_justification: restful API is not based on HTTPS
crypto_tls12_justification: restful API is not based on HTTPS
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: restful API is not based on HTTPS
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers. // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification:
helm deploy onap 
helm undeploy onap
dco_justification: ONAP requires both a Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO), and a Contributor License Agreement (CLA). https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Contribution+Agreements
governance_justification:
The project governance is described at https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance
Further information can be found at https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Technical+Community+Document
code_of_conduct_justification: ONAP adheres to the Linux Foundation Code of Conduct, found at https://lfprojects.org/policies/code-of-conduct/
roles_responsibilities_justification:
The key roles in the project and their responsibilities are described at https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance
Current members are listed at https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8226539
access_continuity_justification:
The committers are listed in the INFO.yaml:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=modeling/etsicatalog.git;a=blob;f=INFO.yaml;h=bb2b662bfa0a85fe192269f954c1bdf1fd640a5f;hb=HEAD
bus_factor_justification:
The committers are listed in the INFO.yaml:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=modeling/etsicatalog.git;a=blob;f=INFO.yaml;h=bb2b662bfa0a85fe192269f954c1bdf1fd640a5f;hb=HEAD
documentation_security_justification: A security sub-committee is driving all components release requirements, best practices. Agreed recommendations become integral parts of an ONAP release and are assessed during milestones. URL : https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Security+coordination The release note clearly states what has been achieved, along with the release checklists and links to individual JIRA items that covers the above security requirements.
documentation_quick_start_justification:
Information on setting up ONAP can be found at: https://docs.onap.org/en/latest/guides/onap-operator/settingup/index.html
Information for Modeling can be found at: https://docs.onap.org/projects/onap-modeling-etsicatalog/en/latest/developer-guide.html
documentation_current_justification: Every release has a branch for documentation, such as: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=vfc/nfvo/lcm.git;a=tree;f=docs;h=135a293809bacdcfe47c9c4863d7ce2cc0e495d5;hb=HEAD
documentation_achievements_justification: Our project page has the link embedded: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Modeling+Project
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: Overall ONAP adherence to this is probably going to be handled ONAP wide
internationalization_justification: i18n is probably going to be handled ONAP wide
sites_password_security_justification: The project does not store password in the website, repository or downloads.
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when a upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerabilities can be reported using the link https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6591711 Currently we dont have any vulnerabilities reported, but the wiki page explains on how to report a vulnerability and how to report anonymously if you do not want the credit for it.
coding_standards_justification:
Coding style is defined in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style
pylint for python components
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Modeling project utilizes the ONAP checkstyle using the Maven maven-checkstyle-plugin for java project and pylint for python components
build_preserve_debug_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_non_recursive_justification: Maven ensure submodules are built in the proper order. There are no bi-directional cross-dependencies between submodules.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: helm has no optional destination directories, but does let you direct pods to particular worker nodes
installation_development_quick_justifica: You can install the project by helm. The steps are documented in https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/oom.git/docs/oom_quickstart_guide.html
external_dependencies_justification: The external dependencies  are listed in: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=modeling/etsicatalog.git;a=blob;f=requirements.txt;h=addba81e33969e0f2af5dce2ed2031a0cb6053cd;hb=HEAD
dependency_monitoring_justification: NexusIQ sonar scan is run on all the projects on a weekly basis
updateable_reused_components_justificati: You can update the dependencies in requirements.txt when need at any time
interfaces_current_justification: We avoid depending on deprecated/obsolete functions. Sonar scans, which are run daily, identify the use of deprecated functions.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Automatic test suites are run every time before merging the code. The code check in cannot pass with out jenkins posting a +1 on the review.
regression_tests_added50_justification: When regressions occur, we add tests for them.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: We use sonar to measure the overall code/branch coverage.
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
implement_secure_design_justification: in case of exception or any other issue during login for the REST APIs, the request is denied.
signed_releases_justification: ONAP integration team handle it together
version_tags_signed_justification: ONAP integration team handle it together
